trans-unit.source: Configure a Web API project as an API app
trans-unit.target: Configure a Web API project as an API app

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure a Web API project as an API app, using Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure a Web API project as an API app, using Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: Configure a Web API project as an API app
trans-unit.target: Configure a Web API project as an API app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to take an existing Web API project and configure it for deployment as an [API app](app-service-api-apps-why-best-platform.md) in [Azure App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to take an existing Web API project and configure it for deployment as an [API app](app-service-api-apps-why-best-platform.md) in [Azure App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md).

trans-unit.source: Subsequent tutorials in the series show how to [deploy](app-service-dotnet-deploy-api-app.md) and [debug](../app-service-dotnet-remotely-debug-api-app.md) the API app project that you create in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent tutorials in the series show how to [deploy](app-service-dotnet-deploy-api-app.md) and [debug](../app-service-dotnet-remotely-debug-api-app.md) the API app project that you create in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For information about API apps, see [What are API apps?](app-service-api-apps-why-best-platform.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about API apps, see [What are API apps?](app-service-api-apps-why-best-platform.md).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires version 2.6 or later of the Azure SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires version 2.6 or later of the Azure SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: Configure a Web API project
trans-unit.target: Configure a Web API project

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to configure an existing Web API project as an API app.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to configure an existing Web API project as an API app.

trans-unit.source: You'll begin by using the Web API project template to create a Web API project, and then you'll configure it as an API app.
trans-unit.target: You'll begin by using the Web API project template to create a Web API project, and then you'll configure it as an API app.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: Click **File > New Project**.
trans-unit.target: Click **File > New Project**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **ASP.NET Web Application** template.
trans-unit.target: Select the **ASP.NET Web Application** template.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the **Add Application Insights to Project** check box is cleared.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the **Add Application Insights to Project** check box is cleared.

trans-unit.source: Name the project *ContactsList*
trans-unit.target: Name the project *ContactsList*

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New ASP.NET Project** dialog, select the **Empty** project template.
trans-unit.target: In the **New ASP.NET Project** dialog, select the **Empty** project template.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Web API** check box.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Web API** check box.

trans-unit.source: Clear the **Host in the cloud** option.
trans-unit.target: Clear the **Host in the cloud** option.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to generate the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to generate the project.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the project (not the solution), and then select **Add > Azure API App SDK**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the project (not the solution), and then select **Add > Azure API App SDK**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Choose API App Metadata source** dialog, click **Automatic Metadata Generation**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Choose API App Metadata source** dialog, click **Automatic Metadata Generation**.

trans-unit.source: This choice enables the dynamic Swagger UI, which you'll see later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This choice enables the dynamic Swagger UI, which you'll see later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to upload a Swagger metadata file, it is saved with the file name *apiDefinition.swagger.json*, as explained in the following section.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to upload a Swagger metadata file, it is saved with the file name *apiDefinition.swagger.json*, as explained in the following section.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: At this point, Visual Studio installs API app NuGet packages and adds API app metadata to the Web API project.
trans-unit.target: At this point, Visual Studio installs API app NuGet packages and adds API app metadata to the Web API project.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Your API app is now ready to be deployed, and you can follow the [Deploy an API app](app-service-dotnet-deploy-api-app.md) tutorial to do that.
trans-unit.target: Your API app is now ready to be deployed, and you can follow the [Deploy an API app](app-service-dotnet-deploy-api-app.md) tutorial to do that.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
